intro: Pseudospondias microcarpa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy small-fruited spondias, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants like mango and cashew. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and small, yellowish fruits that are typically edible. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
